items.name: changeItem
items.text: This method changes the record bound to the specified item.

items.name: itemIndex
items.text:
The index of the item in `{@link #property!dataItems dataItems}`. Negative
numbers are used to index backwards such that `-1` is the last item.

items.name: recordIndex
items.text: The record's index in the store.

items.name: itemCache
items.text:
The array of component items previously created for this view but not in
current use. This array will contain no more then `{@link #cfg!maxItemCache maxItemCache}` items.

components.name: Ext.dataview.List

items.name: bufferSize
items.text:
The number of items an `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}` list will render beyond those immediately
visible.

To prevent the rendering of items while scrolling, these extra items are
rendered out of view. When the scroller approaches within `minimumBufferSize`
of the end of the rendered range, the extra items trailing the scroll will be
repositioned (and reconfigured) ahead of the scroll.

items.name: collapseDefaults
items.text:
This config object supplies default for the `{@link #cfg!collapsible collapsible}` config. When that
config is simply `true`, this is the complete config object for the group
collapser.

NOTE: This config cannot be changed after instantiation. Instead, change the
`{@link #cfg!collapsible collapsible}` config.

items.name: collapsible
items.text:
This object configures group collapse. It is only applicable when `{@link #cfg!grouped grouped}`.
Set to `false` to disable group collapsibility. The default value of `true`
uses the `{@link #cfg!collapseDefaults collapseDefaults}` config for the final collapser configuration
object. If this config is an object, it is merged with `{@link #cfg!collapseDefaults collapseDefaults}`
giving this object's properties priority over the defaults.

items.name: disclosureProperty
items.text:
A property to check on each record to display the disclosure on a per record
basis. This property must be false to prevent the disclosure from being
displayed on the item.

items.name: grouped
items.text:
Set to `false` turn off all grouping.
This setting is only meaningful if the underlying `{@link #cfg!store store}` has a `grouper`.

items.name: groupFooter
groupHeader
groupPlaceholder
items.text:
This config provides defaults for the placeholder items rendered for collapsed
groups.

items.name: indexBar
items.text:
Set to `true` to render an alphabet IndexBar docked on the right. This can also
be a config object for the {@link Ext.dataview.IndexBar IndexBar} component.

items.name: infinite
items.text:
Set to `true` to if this list should anticipate too many rows to render to the
DOM at one time. When set to `true`, only a fixed number of rows is rendered at
once, depending on the `{@link #cfg!height height}` or `{@link #cfg!maxHeight maxHeight}` of the list.

When using this mode in an auto-height situation (where the `list` should be
the height of its items), a `{@link #cfg!maxHeight maxHeight}` setting is required. This is due to
the fact that the rendered items are absolutely positioned. As such they do not
directly contribute to the list's height.

When `{@link #cfg!maxHeight maxHeight}` is set, however, an infinite list uses that setting to decide
how many items to render **and** will set an appropriate height on its innermost
element, thereby allowing the list to achieve the proper height.

Note that this configuration can not be dynamically changed after the list has
instantiated.

items.name: itemConfig
items.text:
The object is used to configure the data items created by this data view. The
`{@link #cfg!xtype xtype}` property of this config overrides the container's `{@link #cfg!defaultType defaultType}`.

items.name: maintainChildNodes
items.text:
Set to `true` to maintain the order of rendered items in the DOM `childNodes`. In
an `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}` list this is not normally done for performance reasons but this can
create accessibility issues.

items.name: minimumBufferDistance
items.text:
The minimum number of items beyond the visible area of an `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}` list to
allow before repositioning items on the opposite side to balance the visible
area inside the rendered range.

items.name: onItemDisclosure
items.text:
Set to `true` to display a disclosure icon on each list item. The list will
then fire the `{@link #event!disclose disclose}` event, and the event can be stopped before `{@link #event!childtap childtap}`.
By setting this config to a function, the function passed will be called when
the disclosure is tapped. This can be either a function object or the name of
a {@link Ext.app.ViewController controller} method.

Finally you can specify an object with a `scope` and `handler` property defined.
This will also be bound to the tap event listener and is useful when you want
to change the scope of the handler.

items.name: pinFooters
items.text:
Whether or not to pin {@link #pinnedFooter footers} on bottom of item groups
while scrolling.

items.name: pinHeaders
items.text:
Whether or not to pin {@link #pinnedHeader headers} on top of item groups
while scrolling. Only applicable for `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}` lists.

items.name: pinnedFooter
items.text:
A config object for the pinned footer. Only applicable when {@link #pinFooters}
and {@link #grouped} are `true`.

items.name: pinnedHeader
items.text:
A config object for the pinned header. Only applicable when {@link #pinHeaders}
and {@link #grouped} are `true`.

items.name: preventSelectionOnDisclose
items.text: When `true` item selection is prevented when the user taps a disclose icon.

items.name: preventSelectionOnTool
items.text:
When `true` item selection is prevented when the user taps on a `tool`. This
can be overridden on specific tools by placing the `preventSelection` property
on the tool:

     tools: [{
         type: 'gear',
         preventSelection: false
     }]

items.name: rowLines
items.text:
Set this to `false` to suppress the borders in between the items in this list.
By default the presence of borders between items is determined by the stylesheet.

items.name: scrollable
items.text:
Configuration options to make this Component scrollable. Acceptable values are:

- `true` to enable auto scrolling.
- `false` (or `null`) to disable scrolling - this is the default.
- `{@link #cfg!x x}` or `horizontal` to enable horizontal scrolling only
- `{@link #cfg!y y}` or `vertical` to enable vertical scrolling only

Also accepts a configuration object for a `{@link Ext.scroll.Scroller}` if
if advanced configuration is needed.

The getter for this config returns the {@link Ext.scroll.Scroller Scroller}
instance.  You can use the Scroller API to read or manipulate the scroll position:

    // scrolls the component to 5 on the x axis and 10 on the y axis
    component.getScrollable().scrollTo(5, 10);

items.name: useSimpleItems
items.text:
Setting this to `false` changes the `{@link #cfg!xtype xtype}` of the `{@link #cfg!itemConfig itemConfig}` to the more
flexible {@link Ext.dataview.ListItem listitem} instead of the more efficient
setting of {@link Ext.dataview.SimpleListItem simplelistitem}.

items.name: variableHeights
items.text:
Set to `true` if the items in this list do not all have the same height. This
is `false` by default to avoid measure each row to determine its height.

items.name: verticalOverflow
items.text: This config is set to `true` when an `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}` list has vertical overflow.

items.name: visibleHeight
items.text:
The height of the container in pixels. This is a config to simplify processing
changes in container height.

items.name: visibleTop
items.text:
The top-most visible pixel coordinate. This is the same as the `{@link #cfg!y y}` value of
the `Scroller` but is a config to simplify processing scrolling changes.

items.name: beforegroupcollapse
items.text: Fires before a group collapse starts. Return `false` to cancel the collapse.

items.name: beforegroupexpand
items.text: Fires before a group expand starts. Return `false` to cancel the expand.

items.text:
For infinite lists, not all records are represented in the DOM.

This method will return `true` if the passed record index or
{@link Ext.data.Model record} is represented in the DOM.

items.name: recordOrIndex
items.text:
The {@link Ext.data.Model record} or
record index to test.
`true` if the record is rendered.

items.name: reorderItem
items.text:
Moves the given `item` to be before the `ref` item or index. For `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}`
lists this does not impact the DOM childNodes unless `{@link #cfg!maintainChildNodes maintainChildNodes}` is
specified. In this case the reordering only impacts this container's `{@link #cfg!items items}`
and `innerItems` collections.

Maintaining the order of `{@link #property!dataItems dataItems}` is a separate concern.

items.name: item
items.text: The item to reorder.

items.name: ref
items.text:
The item before which `item` will be placed
or the index in `innerItems` where `item` will be inserted.

items.name: offset
items.text:
An optional adjustment to add to `ref`. Pass `1` to
insert `item` after `ref`.

renderInfo
items.text:
This object tracks coordinate and index information for the rendered
range of records for an `{@link #cfg!infinite infinite}` list.

items.name: atBegin
items.text:
Set to `true` if the rendered range
is at the beginning of the store (`indexTop` is 0).

items.name: atEnd
items.text:
Set to `true` if the rendered range
is at the end of the store (`indexBottom === store.getCount()`).

items.name: top
items.text:
The `{@link #cfg!y y}` coordinate of the top-most
row in the rendered range.

items.name: bottom
items.text:
The `{@link #cfg!y y}` coordinate just beyond
the bottom of the rendered range.

items.name: height
items.text: The height of the rendered range.

items.name: indexTop
items.text:
The store index of the top-most
record in the rendered range.

items.name: indexBottom
items.text:
The store index one beyond
the last record in the rendered range. This ensures that subtracting
`indexBottom - indexTop` is the number of records in the rendered range.

items.name: rowHeight
items.text:
The height of rows in the list. If `{@link #cfg!variableHeights variableHeights}` is `true` this is the minimum
row height.

items.name: template
items.text:
An array of child elements to use as the children of the main element in the {@link
#element} template.  Only used if "children" are not specified explicitly in the
{@link #element} template.

items.name: cardSwitchAnimation

items.name: detailCard
items.text:
provides the information for a leaf
in a Miller column list. In a Miller column, users follow a
hierarchial tree structure to a leaf, which provides information
about the item in the list. The detailCard lists the information at
the leaf.

See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miller_columns

This configuration is ignored when overriding {@link #getItemTextTpl} or

This will be used by the `updateTitle` method in order to change the appropriate component's
text value.

components.name: Ext.Dialog
components.text:
This class provides a convenient way to display a "popup" component to interact with the user that is resizable, draggable and closable (similar to a browser popup window, but contained in the normal Ext JS component tree). This means dialogs are not subject to the restrictions of browser popup windows, but provide similar modal experiences. var dialog = Ext.create({ xtype: 'dialog', title: 'Dialog', maximizable: true, html: 'Content
goes
here', buttons: { ok: function () { // standard button (see below) dialog.destroy(); } } }); dialog.show(); The above use of `{@link #cfg!buttons buttons}` is a {@link Ext.Container#cfg!weighted weighted} container. This form allows the Ext JS config system to merge properties by aligning on `{@link #cfg!itemId itemId}` as the object keys (`'ok'` in this case). This merging capability enables the use of `{@link #cfg!standardButtons standardButtons}` but is also a powerful technique for leveraging class inheritance in your views. ## Standard Buttons The main advantage of using the `{@link #cfg!buttons buttons}` config is the availability of {@link Ext.Panel#cfg!standardButtons standardButtons}. The `{@link #cfg!standardButtons standardButtons}` config describes many common buttons (such as `ok` above) and provides their `text` as well as the proper, platform-specific ordering. Custom buttons can be mixed with standard buttons or can fully replace them: buttons: { ok: 'onOK', verify: { text: 'Verify', handler: 'onVerify', weight: 200 } } When combined, custom buttons are presented first. In the above, the `{@link #cfg!weight weight}` config is used to order the Verify button after the OK button. The weights assigned to the {@link Ext.Panel#cfg!standardButtons standardButtons} vary by platform but `200` is beyond their range. ## Handling ESC and Close Many dialogs have a `Cancel` button (or equivalent) that closes the dialog without taking action. In some cases this action is first confirmed to avoid data loss. A common problem when implementing dialogs is the presence of these other two means to dismiss the dialog since they often bypass the button handler that is expected to be used to achieve an orderly shutdown. With `{@link Ext.Dialog}`, both the ESC key and `{@link #method!close close}` tool handler call the `{@link #method!close close}` method to dismiss the dialog. The `{@link #method!close close}` method (and its `{@link #cfg!closeAction closeAction}` config) are enhanced versions of the implementation in `{@link Ext.Panel}`. The default dismiss sequence uses the `{@link #cfg!dismissAction dismissAction}` config to identify the candidate `{@link #cfg!buttons buttons}`. The most common match here is the `Cancel` button. If there is a matching button then that button's `handler` is called just as if the user had clicked on it instead. The end result is that when using `{@link #cfg!standardButtons standardButtons}` such as `cancel` or `{@link #method!close close}`, you seldom need to worry about ESC or `{@link #method!close close}` tool inconsistency. The handler for your button will be called in all cases. ### Custom Buttons and Options If the dialog has custom buttons, the `{@link #cfg!dismissHandler dismissHandler}` config can be used to direct `{@link #method!close close}` to a suitable method. Ideally this would be the same method connected to the corresponding button. buttons: { goAway: { text: 'Go Away!', handler: 'onGoAway' } }, dismissHandler: 'onGoAway' To simply allow the `{@link #cfg!closeAction closeAction}` config to call `hide` or `destroy` methods for ESC and `{@link #method!close close}`, do the following: dismissHandler: true The {@link #method!close close method} will fire the {@link #event!beforeclose beforeclose} and {@link #event!close close} events in any case. Using the `{@link #cfg!closeAction closeAction}` approach exposes dialogs to this alternate shutdown sequence but can be enabled as above for simple use cases. ## Maximize / Restore The ability to `maximize` (fill the viewport) with the dialog can be quite useful for complex popups. This can take two forms: - The `{@link #cfg!maximizable maximizable}` config to provide a {@link Ext.Tool tool} to `maximize` and also to `restore` the dialog. - The `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` config to control the current state. The `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` config can be used directly if the `{@link #cfg!maximizeTool maximizeTool}` is not desired. In other words, the ability to control the `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` config is not dependent on whether `{@link #cfg!maximizable maximizable}` is set or not. ### Note This class is analogous to the Ext JS Classic Toolkit's 'Ext.window.Window' class. This class has those names (`{@link Ext.Window}` and `{@link Ext.window.Window}`) as alternate class names and the `window` xtype for compatibility sake.

items.name: bodyBorder
items.text:
Controls the border style of the panel body using the following values:

- `true` to enable the border around the panel body (as defined by the theme)
Note that even when enabled, the bodyBorder is only visible when there are
docked items around the edges of the panel.  Where the bodyBorder touches the
panel's outer border it is automatically collapsed into a single border.

- `false` to disable the body border

- `null` - use the value of {@link #cfg-border border} as the value for
`{@link #cfg!bodyBorder bodyBorder}`

items.name: border
centered
items.text:
Configure this as `true` to have this Component centered within its Container.
Setting this value to `true` will make this Component become 'positioned', which means
it will no longer participate in the layout of the Container that it resides in.

items.name: constrainDrag
items.text: Set to `false` to not constrain the dialog to the viewport.

items.name: dismissAction
items.text:
This config lists one or more `{@link #cfg!itemId itemId}` values to look for in this dialog's
`{@link #cfg!buttons buttons}`. The first button to be found from this list will be invoked in
response to the ESC key or the `{@link #method!close close}` tool.

This config is ignored if a `{@link #cfg!dismissHandler dismissHandler}` is specified.

items.name: dismissHandler
items.text:
The function or controller method name to call on ESC key press or `{@link #method!close close}`
tool click.

If this config is specified, `{@link #cfg!dismissAction dismissAction}` will be ignored.

items.name: draggable
items.text:
Set to `true` to allow this component to be dragged. This can also be the config
object for the `{@link Ext.drag.Source}` that will manage the drag.

items.name: floated
items.text:
A Component may be floated above all other components in the application. This means that
the component is absolutely positioned, and will move to the front and occlude other
sibling floated component if clicked.

A Floated component may have floated descendants. It will bring these decendants to the
front with it when brought to the front of its sibling floated components.

By default, descendant floated components are all positioned using the viewport
coordinate system. To make a floating component a positioning parent for descendants,
and have the ancestors positioned relatively, configure the parent floated component
with `{@link #cfg-relative}: true`.

items.name: hideAnimation
items.text:
Animation effect to apply when the Component is being hidden.  Typically you want to use
an outbound animation type such as 'fadeOut' or 'slideOut'. For more animations, check
the {@link Ext.fx.Animation#type} config.

items.name: hideMode
items.text:
A String which specifies how this component's DOM element will be hidden. The
accepted values are any of these:

- `'clip'` : Hide using {@link Ext.dom.Element#CLIP clip}.
- `'display'` : Hide using {@link Ext.dom.Element#DISPLAY display}.
- `'offsets'` : Hide using positioning {@link Ext.dom.Element#OFFSETS offsets}.
- `'opacity'` : Hide using {@link Ext.dom.Element#OPACITY opacity}.
- `'visibility'` : Hide using {@link Ext.dom.Element#VISIBILITY visibility}.

Hiding using ``display`` results in having no dimensions as well as resetting
scroll positions to 0.

The other modes overcome this but may have different trade-offs in certain
circumstances.

items.name: keyMap
items.text:
An object containing handlers for keyboard events. The property names of this
object are the key name and any modifiers. The values of the properties are the
descriptors of how to handle each event.

The handler descriptor can be simply the handler function(either the
literal function or the method name), or it can be an object with these
properties:

 - `handler`: The function or its name to call to handle the event.
 - `scope`: The this pointer context (can be "this" or "controller").
 - `event`: An optional override of the key event to which to listen.

**Important:** Calls to `setKeyMap` do not replace the entire `{@link #cfg!keyMap keyMap}` but
instead update the provided mappings. That is, unless `null` is passed as the
value of the `{@link #cfg!keyMap keyMap}` which will clear the `{@link #cfg!keyMap keyMap}` of all entries.

items.name: maskTapHandler
maximizable
items.text:
Set to `true` to display the 'maximizeTool` to allow the user to maximize the
dialog. Note that when a dialog is maximized, the `{@link #cfg!maximizeTool maximizeTool}` is replaced
with the `{@link #cfg!restoreTool restoreTool}` to give the user the ability to restore the dialog to
its previous size.

This config only controls the presence of the `maximize` and `restore` tools.
The dialog can always be set to `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` by directly setting the config or
calling the `maximize` and `restore` methods.

items.name: maximizeAnimation
items.text: The animation configuration to use when maximizing.

items.name: maximized
items.text:
Set to `true` to display the dialog in a maximized state. Changing this config
after construction will utilize the `{@link #cfg!maximizeAnimation maximizeAnimation}` or `{@link #cfg!restoreAnimation restoreAnimation}`.

These can be avoided by passing `null` to `maximize` or `restore` methods:

     dialog.setMaximized(true);  // uses maximizeAnimation
     // or:
     dialog.maximize(null);      // no animation for this change

     dialog.setMaximized(false); // uses restoreAnimation
     // or:
     dialog.restore(null);       // no animation for this change

items.name: maximizeProxy
items.text:
Configuration options for a proxy dialog to animate to/from maximized state.
The `{@link #cfg!title title}`, `{@link #cfg!iconCls iconCls}`, `{@link #cfg!ui ui}`, `{@link #cfg!cls cls}` and `{@link #cfg!userCls userCls}` will be copied to the proxy.
items.value:
{
    centered: false,
    draggable: false,
    modal: false,
    showAnimation: null,
    hideAnimation: null
}

items.name: maximizeTool
items.text: Configuration options for the `maximize` tool.

items.name: modal
items.text:
`true` to make this Component modal. This will create a mask underneath the
Component that covers its parent and does not allow the user to interact with
any other Components until this Component is dismissed.

items.name: restorable
items.text: This config is used when the dialog is `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` to show the `{@link #cfg!restoreTool restoreTool}`.

items.name: restoreAnimation
items.text: The animation configuration to use when restoring to normal size.

items.name: restoreTool
items.text: Configuration options for the `restore` tool.

items.name: shadow
items.text:
Configure as `true` for the component to have a drop shadow. 'false' will suppress any
default shadow. By default the theme will determine the presence of a shadow.

items.name: showAnimation
items.text:
Animation effect to apply when the Component is being shown.  Typically you want to use
an inbound animation type such as 'fadeIn' or 'slideIn'. For more animations, check the
{@link Ext.fx.Animation#type} config.

items.name: tabIndex
items.text:
DOM tabIndex attribute for this component's
{@link #focusEl}.

items.name: beforemaximize
items.text:
Fires before maximizing the dialog. Returning `false` from this event will cancel
the maximization.

items.name: beforerestore
items.text:
Fires before restoring the dialog. Returning `false` from this event will cancel
the restoration.

items.name: maximize
items.text:
Fires after the dialog has been maximized. If there is a `{@link #cfg!maximizeAnimation maximizeAnimation}` this
event will fire after the animation is complete.

items.name: restore
items.text:
Fires after the dialog has been restored to its original size. If there is a
`{@link #cfg!restoreAnimation restoreAnimation}` this event will fire after the animation is complete.

items.name: maximize
items.text:
Maximizes this dialog by setting the `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` config to `true`. This method
allows the `{@link #cfg!maximizeAnimation maximizeAnimation}` to be skipped or altered using the `animation`
parameter. This parameter applies only to this maximize transition.

items.name: animation
items.text: A one-time replacement for `{@link #cfg!maximizeAnimation maximizeAnimation}`.
A promise that resolves when the animation is complete.

items.name: restore
items.text:
Restores this dialog by clearing the `{@link #cfg!maximized maximized}` config to `false`. This method
allows the `{@link #cfg!restoreAnimation restoreAnimation}` to be skipped or altered using the `animation`
parameter. This parameter applies only to this restore transition.

items.name: animation
items.text: A one-time replacement for `{@link #cfg!restoreAnimation restoreAnimation}`.
A promise that resolves when the animation is complete.

items.name: ariaRole
items.text:
ARIA role for this Component, defaults to no role.
With no role, no other ARIA attributes are set.

items.name: classCls
focusable
items.text:
`true` for keyboard interactive Components or Widgets, `false` otherwise.
For Containers, this property reflects interactiveness of the
Container itself, not its children. See {@link #isFocusable}.

**Note:** It is not enough to set this property to `true` to make
a component keyboard interactive. You also need to make sure that
the component's {@link #focusEl} is reachable via Tab key (tabbable).
See also {@link #tabIndex}.

items.name: isDialog
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object this type, or subclass thereof.

items.name: dialog-ui
items.text: Creates a visual theme for a Dialog.

items.name: $ui
items.text:
The name of the UI being created. Can not included spaces or special punctuation
(used in CSS class names).

items.name: $xtype
items.text:
The {@link Ext.Class#xtype} to use
in CSS selectors.  For use by UI mixins of derived classes.

items.name: $header-xtype

in CSS selectors for the header component.  For use by UI mixins of derived classes.

items.name: $title-xtype

items.name: $tool-xtype

in CSS selectors for tools.  For use by UI mixins of derived classes.

components.name: Ext.Editor

items.name: alignment
items.text: The position to align to (see {@link Ext.util.Positionable#alignTo} for more details).

items.name: allowBlur
items.text:
True to {@link #completeEdit complete the editing process} if in edit mode when focus exits
from this Editor's hierarchy.

items.name: cancelOnClear
items.text: True to cancel edit when the clear icon of a field is pressed

items.name: cancelOnEsc
items.text: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed.

items.name: completeOnEnter
items.text: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed.

items.name: constrain
items.text: True to constrain the editor to the viewport

items.name: field
items.text: Config object for a {@link Ext.field.Field}

items.name: hideEl
items.text: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed

items.name: ignoreNoChange
items.text:
True to skip the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an
edit and the value has not changed.  Applies only to string values - edits for other data
types will never be ignored.

items.name: matchFont
items.text: Determines if the editor input should match the font style of the target element

items.name: offset
items.text: The offset to use when aligning (see {@link Ext.util.Positionable#alignTo} for more details.

items.name: parentEl
items.text: An element to render to.

items.name: revertInvalid
items.text:
True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an
edit and the field
validation fails

items.name: shadow
items.text: "sides" for sides/bottom only, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right shadow.

items.name: swallowKeys
items.text: Handle the keydown/keypress events so they don't propagate

items.name: updateEl
items.text: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes

items.name: value
items.text: The data value of the underlying field

items.name: beforecomplete
items.text:
Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the
underlying field.  Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from
the handler of this event. Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true,
the editing will still end but this event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

items.name: value
items.text: The current field value

items.name: startValue
items.text: The original field value

items.name: beforestartedit
items.text:
Fires when editing is initiated, but before the value changes.  Editing can be canceled by
returning false from the handler of this event.

items.name: boundEl
items.text: The underlying element bound to this editor

items.name: value
items.text: The field value being set

items.name: canceledit
items.text: Fires after editing has been canceled and the editor's value has been reset.

items.name: value
items.text: The user-entered field value that was discarded

items.name: startValue
items.text:
The original field value that was set back into the editor after
cancel

items.name: complete
items.text:
Fires after editing is complete and any changed value has been written to the underlying
field.

items.name: value
items.text: The current field value

items.name: startValue
items.text: The original field value

items.name: specialkey
items.text:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed. You can
check
{@link Ext.event.Event#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

items.name: field
items.text: The field attached to this editor

items.name: event
items.text: The event object

items.name: startedit
items.text: Fires when this editor is displayed

items.name: boundEl
items.text: The underlying element bound to this editor

items.name: value
items.text: The starting field value

items.name: cancelEdit
items.text:
Cancels the editing process and hides the editor without persisting any changes. The field
value will be reverted to the original starting value.

items.name: remainVisible
items.text:
Override the default behavior and keep the editor
visible after cancel

items.name: followItem
items.text: Pass `true` to ensure the item remains visible.

items.name: completeEdit
items.text:
Ends the editing process, persists the changed value to the underlying field, and hides the
editor.

items.name: remainVisible
items.text:
Override the default behavior and keep the editor
visible after edit

items.name: followItem
items.text:
Pass `true` to ensure the item remains visible,
that is, the component that contains the editor. This is used by grid cell editing to
track the item (i.e., the row component) since it may move due to edit of sorted fields.

The location where editing is active *if* editing is
active, else `null`.

items.name: getValue
items.text: Gets the data value of the editor
The data value

items.name: realign
items.text: Realigns the editor to the bound field based on the current alignment config value.

items.name: setValue
items.text: Sets the data value of the editor

items.name: value
items.text: Any valid value supported by the underlying field

items.name: startEdit
items.text: Starts the editing process and shows the editor.

items.name: el
items.text: The element to edit

items.name: value
items.text:
A value to initialize the editor with. If a value is not
provided, it defaults to the innerHTML of el.

items.name: editing
items.text: True if this editor is currently active.

components.name: Ext.field.Field

items.name: autoFitErrors
items.text:
Whether to adjust the field's body width to make room for the
{@link #errorTarget error messages}.

items.name: bodyAlign
items.text: The horizontal alignment the contents of this field's body element.

items.name: dataType
disabled
items.text:
`true` to disable the field.

Be aware that conformant with the [HTML specification](http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html),
disabled Fields will not be {@link Ext.form.Panel#method-submit submitted}.

items.name: error
items.text:
The error (or errors) to display for this field. This config is typically set
by the field's {@link #cfg!validators validators} but can be set directly if
an error needs to be associated with a field manually.

Errors will be HTML encoded as necessary and {@link #cfg!errorTpl formatted}
before becoming the current {@link #cfg!errorMessage}.

items.name: errorMessage
items.text:
The field's error message to display as {@link #cfg!errorTarget specified}.
This message must already be properly formatted and encoded as appropriate
for the `{@link #cfg!errorTarget errorTarget}`.

items.name: errorTarget
items.text:
The location where the error message text should display.

The following are values that have predefined meaning:

- `qtip` Display a {@link Ext.tip.Manager quick tip} containing the message
 when the user hovers (or taps) the field. For this option to work, quick tips
 must be enabled by calling {@link Ext.tip.Manager#init}.
- `side` Add an error icon to the right of the field, displaying the message
 in a popup on hover or tap.
- `title` Display the message in a default browser `title` attribute.
- `under` Add a `div` beneath the field containing the error message.

items.name: errorTip
items.text: The default config that will be used to display errors in the tooltip.

items.name: errorTpl
items.text:
The template used to format the {@link #cfg!error error} set for this field.
By default, the {@link #cfg!errorTarget errorTarget} is used to determine
whether the error(s) are formatted as an HTML list or as plain text.

items.name: inline
items.text:
`true` to cause this field to layout with inline element behavior.
An inline field's width is determined by the total width of its label and body
elements instead of automatically expanding to fill the width of its container.

items.name: label
items.text: The label of this field

items.name: labelAlign
items.text: The position to render the label relative to the field body.

items.name: labelCls
items.text: Optional CSS class to add to the Label element.

items.name: labelMinWidth
items.text: Min-width of this field's label.

items.name: labelTextAlign
items.text: Text alignment of this field's label

items.name: labelWidth
items.text:
Width of this field's label. Can be a number of pixels or any valid CSS value,
such as `'30%'`. To size the label to its text, use `labelWidth: 'auto'`

items.name: labelWrap
items.text:
`true` to allow the label to wrap. If set to `false`, the label will be truncated
with an ellipsis.

items.name: name
items.text:
The field's name.  Used by form panels to gather data to be submitted.

For {@link Ext.field.Input Input Fields} this name is set as the `{@link #cfg!name name}` attribute
of the `inputElement`

items.name: required
items.text: `true` to make this field required.

items.name: requiredMessage
items.text:
The error message to display when {@link #required} is `true` and the field's
value is "empty" (`null`, `undefined`, or empty string).

items.name: validateDisabled
items.text: `true` to validate the field, even if it is disabled.

items.name: validationMessage
items.text: For validation, regex, etc., this is the error message returned if field is invalid.

items.name: validators
items.text:
A validator or array of validators to be applied to the field.

When the field is validated, each validator is applied and if any one of them
determines the field  is invalid, the field will be marked as invalid.  If you
examine the field's validators, you will get an array of Ext.data.Validators.

Validation currently is synchronous.  If you need to validate a field with interaction
with a server, you would do this when the form is submitted.

A validator may be:

* A regexp - if the field fails to match the regexp, it is invalid.
* A function - the function will be called to validate the field; it should return
false if invalid.

* An object - an object with a member fn that is a function to be called to validate
the field.

* An instantiated Validator {@link  Ext.data.validator.Validator}

items.name: value
items.text: The field's value

items.name: change
items.text: Fires when the value has changed.

items.name: this
items.text: This field

items.name: newValue
items.text: The new value

items.name: oldValue
items.text: The original value

items.name: click
items.text: Fires whenever the input is clicked.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object.

items.name: errorchange
items.text: Fires when the active error message changes.

items.name: error
items.text: The current error message

items.name: keyup
items.text: Fires whenever keyup is detected.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object.

items.name: mousedown
items.text: Fires whenever the input has a mousedown occur.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object.

items.name: paste
items.text: Fires whenever paste is detected.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object.

items.name: clearInvalid
items.text: Mark field as valid.

items.name: completeEdit
items.text:
Called when focus leaves this input field.
Used to postprocess raw values and perform conversion and validation.

items.name: didValueChange
items.text:
Checks if the value has changed. Allows subclasses to override for
any more complex logic.

items.name: doValidate
items.text:
This method is called by {@link #method!validate validate} if the value is both
non-empty (not `null`, `undefined` or `''`) and if the value can be parsed by the
{@link #method!parseValue parseValue} method. This parsing concern is technically
only in play for `{@link Ext.field.Text}` and derived classes (such as `{@link Ext.field.Date}` and
`{@link Ext.field.Number}`) but the guarantee here is that the `{@link #cfg!value value}` will be a parsed
value and not the raw string and if the value cannot be parsed, this method will
not be called.

items.name: value
items.text: The (parsed) value

items.name: errors
items.text: The array of validation errors

items.name: skipLazy
items.text: `false` (the default) to run all validators.

items.name: formatErrors
items.text:
Formats the given error(s) based on the given {@link #cfg!errorTpl} and the
specified {@link #cfg!errorTarget}.

items.name: getRawValue
items.text:
Returns the raw value of the field, without performing any normalization, conversion,
or validation. To get a normalized and converted value see {@link #getValue}.
value The raw String value of the field

items.name: isDirty
items.text:
Returns `true` if the value of this Field has been changed from its {@link #originalValue}.
Will return `false` if the field is disabled or has not been rendered yet.

`true` if this field has been changed from its original value (and
is not disabled), `false` otherwise.

items.name: isEqual
items.text:
Returns whether two field {@link #getValue values} are logically equal.
Field implementations may override this to provide custom comparison logic appropriate
for the particular field's data type.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value to compare

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value to compare
True if the values are equal, false if inequal.

items.name: isValid
items.text: Returns true if field is valid.

items.name: markInvalid
items.text: Mark field as invalid.

items.name: processRawValue
items.text:
Performs any necessary manipulation of a raw field value to prepare it for
{@link #rawToValue conversion} and/or {@link #validate validation}, for instance
stripping out ignored characters. In the base implementation it does nothing;
individual subclasses may override this as needed.

items.name: value
items.text: The unprocessed string value
The processed string value

items.name: rawToValue
items.text:
Converts a raw input field value into a mixed-type value that is suitable for this particular
field type. This allows controlling the normalization and conversion of user-entered values
into field-type-appropriate values, e.g. a Date object for {@link Ext.field.Date},
and is invoked by {@link #getValue}.

It is up to individual implementations to decide how to handle raw values that cannot be
successfully converted to the desired object type.

The base implementation does no conversion, returning the raw value untouched.
The converted value.

items.name: reset

items.text: this

items.name: resetOriginalValue
items.text:
Resets the field's {@link #originalValue} property so it matches the current
{@link #getValue value}. This is called by
{@link Ext.form.Panel}.{@link Ext.form.Panel#setValues setValues} if the form's
{@link Ext.form.Panel#trackResetOnLoad trackResetOnLoad} property is set to true.

items.name: serialize
items.text:
A function which converts the fields value for submission. This is the value used
for form submit. The field's value is serialized using the serializer for the
associated {@link Ext.data.Model} when using `{@link #cfg!modelValidation modelValidation}`, or using the
serializer specified by the {@link #dataType} config.

items.name: toggleInvalidCls
items.text: Add/remove invalid class(es)

items.name: transformRawValue
items.text: Transform the raw value before it is set

items.name: value
items.text: The value
The value to set

items.name: validate
items.text:
Validate the field and return it's validity state.
To get the existing validity state without re-validating current value,
use {@link isValid}.

items.name: skipLazy
items.text: Pass `true` to skip validators marked as `lazy`.
The new validity state.

items.name: htmlErrorsTpl
items.text:
The default template used to format errors in HTML. This property is promoted
to an `{@link Ext.XTemplate}` instance on first use.

items.name: isField
items.text:
`true` in this class to identify an object this type, or subclass thereof.

This is used by {@link Ext.form.Panel#getValues} to determine which
components inside a form are fields.

items.name: originalValue
items.text: The original value when the field was instantiated.

items.name: plainErrorsTpl
items.text:
The default template used to format errors as plain text. This property is promoted
to an `{@link Ext.XTemplate}` instance on first use.

items.name: validateOnInit
items.text:
Determines how initial values will handle validation
- none: Will not validate any initial values
- auto: Will only validate non-empty initial values
- all: Will validate all initial values

items.name: field-ui
items.text: Creates a visual theme for a Field

The name of the UI being created. Can not included spaces or special punctuation
(used in CSS class names).

items.name: $xtype
items.text:
The {@link Ext.Class#xtype} to use
in CSS selectors.  For use by UI mixins of derived classes.

components.name: Ext.field.Checkbox

items.name: checked
items.text: `true` if the checkbox should render initially checked.

items.name: publishes
shareableName
items.text:
Set to `true` to allow this component's `{@link #cfg!name name}` to be shared by other items in the
same `nameHolder`. Such items will be returned in an array from `lookupName`.

items.name: twoWayBindable
items.text:
This object holds a map of `config` properties that will update their binding
as they are modified. For example, `{@link #cfg!value value}` is a key added by form fields. The
form of this config is the same as `{@link #cfg!publishes}`.

This config is defined so that updaters are not created and added for all
bound properties since most cannot be modified by the end-user and hence are
not appropriate for two-way binding.

This checkbox.

items.name: classCls
defaultBindProperty
items.text:
This property is used to determine the property of a `{@link #cfg!bind bind}` config that is just
the value. For example, if `defaultBindProperty="value"`, then this shorthand
`{@link #cfg!bind bind}` config:

     bind: '{name}'

Is equivalent to this object form:

     bind: {
         value: '{name}'
     }

The `{@link #property!defaultBindProperty defaultBindProperty}` is set to "value" for form fields and to "store" for
grids and trees.

components.name: Ext.field.CheckboxGroup
components.text:
This Field is useful for containing multiple {@link Ext.field.Checkbox checkbox}.

 It plots items into wither horizontal / vertical depending on
 {@link Ext.field.FieldGroupContainer#vertical} config properties.


 ```javascript
 @example({ framework: 'extjs' }
     Ext.create('Ext.form.Panel', {
         title: 'Checkbox Group',
         width: 300,
         height: 125,
         fullscreen: true,
         items:[{
             xtype: 'checkboxgroup',
             label: 'Checkbox Group',
             // Arrange checkboxes distributed vertically.
             // Automatically latter items flow to next column if
             // available height is less to display all the items in single column.
             vertical: true,
             height: 100,
             items: [
                 { label: 'Item 1', name: 'cb-item-1', value: '1' },
                 { label: 'Item 2', name: 'cb-item-2', value: '2', checked: true },
                 { label: 'Item 3', name: 'cb-item-3', value: '3' },
                 { label: 'Item 4', name: 'cb-common', value: '4' },
                 { label: 'Item 5', name: 'cb-common', value: '5' },
                 { label: 'Item 6', name: 'cb-common', value: '6' }
             ]
         }]
     }
 );

 ```
 ```javascript
 @example({framework: 'ext-react', packages:['ext-react']})
 import React, { Component } from 'react';
 import { ExtFormPanel, ExtCheckBoxGroup, ExtCheckBoxField } from '@sencha/ext-react';

 export default class MyExample extends Component {
      render() {
           return (
               <ExtFormPanel
                title="Checkbox Group"
                width="300"
                height="125"
                fullscreen={true}
               >
                   <ExtCheckBoxGroup
                       label="Checkbox Group"
                       vertical
                       height="100"
                   >
                       <ExtCheckBoxField
                           label="Item 1"
                           name="cb-item-1"
                           value="1"
                       >
                       </ExtCheckBoxField>
                       <ExtCheckBoxField
                           label="Item 2"
                           name="cb-item-2"
                           value="2"
                           checked="true"
                       >
                       </ExtCheckBoxField>
                       <ExtCheckBoxField
                           label="Item 3"
                           name="cb-item-3"
                           value="3"
                       >
                       </ExtCheckBoxField>
                       <ExtCheckBoxField
                           label="Item 4"
                           name="cb-common"
                           value="4"
                       >
                       </ExtCheckBoxField>
                       <ExtCheckBoxField
                           label="Item 5"
                           name="cb-common"
                           value="5"
                       >
                       </ExtCheckBoxField>
                       <ExtCheckBoxField
                           label="Item 6"
                           name="cb-common"
                           value="6"
                       >
                       </ExtCheckBoxField>
                   </ExtCheckBoxGroup>
               </ExtFormPanel>
           )
      }
 }
 ```
 ```javascript
 @example({framework: 'ext-angular', packages:['ext-angular']})
 import { Component } from '@angular/core'
 declare var Ext: any;

 @Component({
     selector: 'checkboxgroup-component',
     styles: [``],
     template: `
         <ExtFormPanel
              title="Checkbox Group"
              [width]="600"
              [height]="400"
              [fullscreen]="true"
          >
              <ExtCheckBoxGroup
                  label="Checkbox Group"
                  [vertical]="true"
                  [height]="100"
              >
                  <ExtCheckBoxField
                      [label]="'Item 1'"
                      [name]="'cb-item-1'"
                      value="1"
                  >
                  </ExtCheckBoxField>
                  <ExtCheckBoxField
                      [label]="'Item 2'"
                      [name]="'cb-item-2'"
                      value="2"
                      [checked]="true"
                  >
                  </ExtCheckBoxField>
                  <ExtCheckBoxField
                      [label]="'Item 3'"
                      [name]="'cb-item-3'"
                      value="3"
                  >
                  </ExtCheckBoxField>
                  <ExtCheckBoxField
                      [label]="'Item 4'"
                      [name]="'cb-common'"
                      value="4"
                  >
                  </ExtCheckBoxField>
                  <ExtCheckBoxField
                      [label]="'Item 5'"
                      [name]="'cb-common'"
                      value="5"
                  >
                  </ExtCheckBoxField>
                  <ExtCheckBoxField
                      [label]="'Item 6'"
                      [name]="'cb-common'"
                      value="6"
                  >
                  </ExtCheckBoxField>
              </ExtCheckBoxGroup>
          </ExtFormPanel>
      `
 })
 export class CheckBoxGroupComponent  {}
```

items.name: getValue
items.text:
Returns an object containing the values of all checked checkboxes within the group.
Each key-value pair in the object corresponds to a checkbox
{@link Ext.field.Checkbox#name name}. If there is only one checked checkbox
with a particular name, the value of that pair will be the String
{@link Ext.field.Checkbox#value value} of that checkbox. If there are
multiple checked checkboxes with that name, the value of that pair will be an Array
of the selected inputValues.

The object format returned from this method can also be passed directly to the
{@link #setValue} method.

items.name: setValue
value
items.text: The mapping of checkbox names to values.
this

items.name: defaultType
items.text: Default item type in radio group

items.name: isCheckboxGroup
items.text: The value `true` to identify an object as an instance of this or derived class.

components.name: Ext.field.ComboBox

items.name: allQuery
items.text:
The text query to use to filter the store when the trigger element is tapped
(or expansion is requested by a keyboard gesture). By default, this is `null`
causing no filtering to occur.

items.name: anyMatch
items.text:
* Only valid when {@link #cfg!queryMode} is `'local'`.*
Configure as `true` to cause the {@link #cfg!primaryFilter} to match the typed
characters at any position in the {@link #displayField}'s value when filtering
*locally*.

items.name: autoSelect
items.text:
`true` to auto select the first value in the {@link #store} or {@link #options} when
they are changed. Only happens when the {@link #value} is set to `null`.

items.name: caseSensitive
items.text:
* Only valid when {@link #cfg!queryMode} is `'local'`.*
Configure as `true` to cause the {@link #cfg!primaryFilter} to match with
exact case matching.

items.name: editable
items.text:
Configure as `false` to prevent the user from typing text directly into the
field; the field can only have its value set programmatically or via an action
invoked by a trigger.

Contrast with {@link #cfg!readOnly} which disables all mutation via the UI.

items.name: enableRegEx
items.text:
*When {@link #queryMode} is `'local'` only*

Set to `true` to have the ComboBox use the typed value as a RegExp source to
filter the store to get possible matches.
Invalid regex values will be ignored.

items.name: forceSelection
items.text:
Set to `true` to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, or
`false` to allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field.

items.name: minChars
primaryFilter
items.text:
A filter config object, or a Filter instance used to filter the store on input
field mutation by typing or pasting.

This may be a filter config object which specifies a filter which uses the
{@link #cfg!store}'s fields.

{@link Ext.util.Filter Filters} may also be instantiated using a custom `filterFn`
to allow a developer to specify complex matching. For example, a combobox developer
might allow a user to filter using either the {@link #cfg!valueField} or
{@link #cfg!displayField} by using:

    primaryFilter: function(candidateRecord) {
        // This called in the scope of the Filter instance, we have this config
        var value = this.getValue();

        return Ext.String.startsWith(candidateRecord.get('stateName', value, true) ||
               Ext.String.startsWith(candidateRecord.get('abbreviation', value, true);
    }

This may also be configured as the name of a method on a ViewController which is to
be used as the filtering function. Note that this will *still* be called in the
scope of the created Filter object because that has access to the `{@link #cfg!value value}`
which is being tested for.

items.name: queryCaching
items.text:
When true, this prevents the combo from re-querying (either locally or remotely)
when the current query is the same as the previous query.

items.name: queryDelay
items.text:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending
the query to filter the dropdown list.

Defaults to `500` if `{@link #queryMode} = 'remote'` or `10` if
`{@link #queryMode} = 'local'`

items.name: queryMode
items.text:
The mode in which the ComboBox uses the configured Store. Acceptable values are:

 - **`'local'`** : In this mode, the ComboBox assumes the store is fully loaded and
  will query it directly.

 - **`'remote'`** : In this mode the ComboBox loads its Store dynamically based upon
  user interaction.

  This is typically used for "autocomplete" type inputs, and after the user finishes
  typing, the Store is {@link Ext.data.Store#method!load load}ed.

  A parameter containing the typed string is sent in the load request. The default
  parameter name for the input string is `query`, but this can be configured using
  the {@link #cfg!queryParam} config.

  In `queryMode: 'remote'`, the Store may be configured with
  `{@link Ext.data.Store#cfg!remoteFilter remoteFilter}: true`, and further filters
  may be _programmatically_ added to the Store which are then passed with every
  load request which allows the server to further refine the returned dataset.

  Typically, in an autocomplete situation, {@link #cfg!hideTrigger} is configured
  `true` because it has no meaning for autocomplete.

items.name: queryParam
items.text:
Name of the parameter used by the Store to pass the typed string when the ComboBox
is configured with
`{@link #queryMode}: 'remote'`. If explicitly set to a falsy value it will not be
sent.

items.name: triggerAction
items.text:
The action to execute when the trigger is clicked.

 - **`'all'`** :

  {@link #doFilter run the query} specified by the `{@link #cfg!allQuery}` config option

 - **`'last'`** :

  {@link #doFilter run the query} using the `{@link #lastQuery last query value}`.

 - **`'query'`** :

  {@link #doFilter run the query} using the {@link Ext.form.field.Base#getRawValue
  raw value}.

See also `{@link #queryParam}`.

items.name: typeAhead
items.text:
`true` to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after
a configurable delay ({@link #typeAheadDelay}) if it matches a known value.

items.name: typeAheadDelay
items.text:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if {@link #typeAhead} is `true`.

items.name: beforepickercreate
items.text: Fires before the pop-up picker is created to give a developer a chance to configure it.

items.name: newValue
items.text: The config object for the picker.

items.name: beforequery
items.text:
Fires before all queries are processed. Return false to cancel the query or set the
queryPlan's cancel property to true.

items.name: queryPlan
items.text: An object containing details about the query to be executed.

items.name: combo
items.text: A reference to this ComboBox.

items.name: query
items.text:
The query value to be used to match against the ComboBox's
{@link #valueField}.

items.name: force
items.text:
If `true`, causes the query to be executed even if the
minChars threshold is not met.

items.name: cancel
items.text:
A boolean value which, if set to `true` upon return,
causes the query not to be executed.

items.name: lastQuery
items.text: The queryPlan object used in the previous query.

items.name: change
items.text: Fires when the field is changed, or if forceSelection is false, on keystroke.

items.name: this
items.text: This field

items.name: newValue
items.text: The new value

items.name: oldValue
items.text: The original value

items.name: pickercreate
items.text: Fires after the pop-up picker is created to give a developer a chance to configure it.

items.name: picker
items.text: The instantiated picker.

items.name: select
items.text: Fires when the user has selected an item from the associated picker.

items.name: this
items.text: This field

items.name: newValue
items.text: The corresponding record for the new value

items.name: beforeFilter
items.text:
A method which may modify aspects of how the store is to be filtered (if
{@link #queryMode} is `"local"`) of loaded (if {@link #queryMode} is `"remote"`).

This is called by the {@link #doFilter method, and may be overridden in subclasses to modify
the default behaviour.

This method is passed an object containing information about the upcoming query operation
which it may modify before returning.

items.name: queryPlan
items.text: An object containing details about the query to be executed.

items.name: query
items.text:
The query value to be used to match against the
ComboBox's {@link #textField}.
If not present, the primary {@link #cfg!textfield} filter is disabled.

items.name: lastQuery
items.text:
The query value used the last time a store query
was made.

items.name: force
items.text:
If `true`, causes the query to be executed even if
the minChars threshold is not met.

items.name: cancel
items.text:
A boolean value which, if set to `true` upon
return, causes the query not to be executed.

items.name: doFilter
items.text:
Executes a query to filter the dropdown list. Fires the {@link #beforequery} event
prior to performing the query allowing the query action to be canceled if needed.

items.name: query
items.text: An object containing details about the query to be executed.

items.name: query
force
items.text:
If `true`, causes the query to be executed even if
the {@link #cfg!minChars} threshold is not met.
`true` if the query resulted in picker expansion.

items.name: doRawFilter
items.text: Execute the query with the raw contents within the textfield.

items.name: onCollectionAdd
items.text: Respond to selection. Needed if we are multiselect

items.name: onExpandTap
items.text: Show the dropdown based upon triggerAction and allQuery

items.name: onStoreFilterChange
items.text:
Called when local filtering is being used.
Only effective when NOT actively using the primary filter

items.name: serializePrimaryFilter
items.text:
A method that may be overridden in a subclass which serializes the primary filter
(the filter that passes the typed value for transmission to the server in the
{@link #cfg!queryParam}).

The provided implementation simply passes the filter's textual value as the
{@link #cfg!queryParam} value.

items.name: filter

components.name: Ext.field.Number

items.name: decimals
items.text: The maximum precision to display after the decimal separator.

items.name: decimalSeparator
items.text:
Character(s) to allow as the decimal separator.
Defaults to {@link Ext.util.Format#decimalSeparator decimalSeparator}.

items.name: decimalsText
items.text:
The error message that will be displayed if the field's value has incorrect number of
decimal places.

items.name: inputType
items.text:
For desktop environments, an input of `type=text` is used and a rich user experience
is provided for numeric entry. For mobile environments, an input of `type=number` is
used and basic validation is performed on keystroke and `{@link #cfg!minValue minValue}` and `{@link #cfg!maxValue maxValue}`
clamping is only done on blur or `setValue` if the field is not focused.

If you specify `{@link #cfg!inputType inputType}` of `'text'`, the text input will be used on all devices
at the expense of numeric input keyboard on non-iOS devices. Alternatively, you may
specify an `{@link #cfg!inputType inputType}` of `'tel'` which will bring up the phone number input
keyboard, which isn't as ideal as the numeric keyboard.

components.name: Ext.field.Panel

items.name: api
items.text:
If specified, load and submit (see `formpanel`) actions will be loaded and
submitted via Ext Direct. Methods which have been imported by
{@link Ext.direct.Manager} can be specified here to load and submit forms.

API methods may also be specified as strings and will be parsed into the actual
functions when the first submit or load has occurred.

For example, instead of the following:

     api: {
         load: App.ss.MyProfile.load,
         submit: App.ss.MyProfile.submit
     }

You can use strings:

     api: {
         load: 'App.ss.MyProfile.load',
         submit: 'App.ss.MyProfile.submit'
     }

You can also use a prefix instead of fully qualified function names:

     api: {
         prefix: 'App.ss.MyProfile',
         load: 'load',
         submit: 'submit'
     }

Load actions can use {@link #paramOrder} or {@link #paramsAsHash} to customize
how the {@link #method!load load method} is invoked.

For `formpanel`, submit actions will always use a standard form submit. The
`formHandler` configuration (see Ext.direct.RemotingProvider#action) must be
set on the associated server-side method which has been imported by
{@link Ext.direct.Manager}.

items.name: baseParams
items.text:
Optional set of params to be sent.

For `formpanel` this only applies when `standardSubmit` is set to `false`.

items.name: nameable
items.text:
Set to `true` for this component's `{@link #cfg!name name}` property to be tracked by its containing
`{@link #cfg!nameHolder nameHolder}`.
Forms can be assigned names to be used in parent forms.

items.name: nameHolder
items.text:
When `true` child components are tracked by their `{@link #cfg!name name}` property and can be
retrieved using the `{@link #method!lookupName lookupName}` method.

items.name: paramOrder
items.text:
A list of params to be executed server side. Only used for the
{@link #cfg!api load} config.

Specify the params in the order in which they must be executed on the
server-side as either (1) a String[], or (2) a String of params delimited by
either whitespace, comma, or pipe.

For example, any of the following would be acceptable:

    paramOrder: ['param1','param2','param3']
    paramOrder: 'param1 param2 param3'
    paramOrder: 'param1,param2,param3'
    paramOrder: 'param1|param2|param'

items.name: paramsAsHash
items.text:
If true, parameters will be sent as a single hash collection of named arguments.
Providing a {@link #paramOrder} nullifies this configuration.

Only used for the {@link #cfg!api load} config.

items.name: scrollable
items.text:
Configuration options to make this Component scrollable. Acceptable values are:

- `true` to enable auto scrolling.
- `false` (or `null`) to disable scrolling - this is the default.
- `{@link #cfg!x x}` or `horizontal` to enable horizontal scrolling only
- `{@link #cfg!y y}` or `vertical` to enable vertical scrolling only

Also accepts a configuration object for a `{@link Ext.scroll.Scroller}` if
if advanced configuration is needed.

The getter for this config returns the {@link Ext.scroll.Scroller Scroller}
instance.  You can use the Scroller API to read or manipulate the scroll position:

    // scrolls the component to 5 on the x axis and 10 on the y axis
    component.getScrollable().scrollTo(5, 10);

items.name: shareableName
items.text:
Set to `true` to allow this component's `{@link #cfg!name name}` to be shared by other items in the
same `{@link #cfg!nameHolder nameHolder}`. Such items will be returned in an array from `{@link #method!lookupName lookupName}`.
Forms can be assigned the same name as other forms in their parent form. This
means that if a form is assigned a `{@link #cfg!name name}` it will be returned as an array from
`{@link #method!lookupName lookupName}` in its parent form.

items.name: timeout
items.text: Timeout for server actions (in seconds).

items.name: url
items.text: The default URL for server actions (`{@link #method!load load}` and `submit` in `formpanel`).

items.name: exception
items.text:
Fires when either the Ajax HTTP request reports a failure OR the server returns a
`success:false` response in the result payload.

items.name: this
items.text: This container.

items.name: result
items.text:
Either a failed `{@link Ext.data.Connection}` request object or a
failed (logical) server response payload.

items.name: load
items.text: Performs an Ajax or Ext Direct call to load values for this form.

items.name: options
items.text:
The configuration when loading this form.

The following are the configurations when loading via Ajax only:

items.name: url
items.text: The url for the action (defaults to the form's {@link #url}).

items.name: method
items.text:
The form method to use (defaults to the form's {@link #method}, or GET if not
defined).

items.name: headers
items.text: Request headers to set for the action.

items.name: timeout
items.text:
The number is seconds the loading will timeout in.

The following are the configurations when loading via Ajax or Direct:

items.name: autoAbort
items.text: `true` to abort any pending Ajax request prior to loading.

items.name: params
items.text:
The params to pass when submitting this form (defaults to {@link #baseParams}).
Parameters are encoded as standard HTTP parameters using {@link Ext#urlEncode}.

items.name: waitMsg
items.text:
If specified, the value which is passed to the loading {@link #masked mask}. See
{@link #masked} for more information.

items.name: success
items.text:
The callback that will be invoked after a successful response. A response is
successful if a response is received from the server and is a JSON object where the
`success` property is set to `true`, `{"success": true}`.

The function is passed the following parameters and can be used for loading via
Ajax or Direct:

items.name: form
items.text: The {@link Ext.form.Panel} that requested the load.

items.name: result
items.text:
The result object returned by the server as a result of the load request. If the
loading was done via Ext Direct, will return the {@link Ext.direct.Event} instance,
otherwise will return an Object.

items.name: data
items.text: The parsed data returned by the server.

items.name: failure
items.text:
The callback that will be invoked after a failed transaction attempt.

The function is passed the following parameters and can be used for loading via
Ajax or Direct:

items.name: form
items.text: The {@link Ext.form.Panel} that requested the load.

items.name: result
items.text:
The failed response or result object returned by the server which performed the
operation.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope in which to call the callback functions (The `this` reference for the
callback functions).
The request object.

components.name: Ext.field.Picker
components.text:
An abstract class for fields that have a single trigger which opens a "picker" popup
above the field. It provides a base implementation for toggling the picker's
visibility when the trigger is tapped.

You would not normally use this class directly, but instead use it as the parent
class for a specific picker field implementation.

items.name: alignTarget
items.text:
The element reference to which the {@link #cfg!picker floated picker} aligns
and sizes to. By default, it sizes to the `bodyElement` which encapsulates the
input field and triggers.

An alternate value which may be useful if using `{@link #cfg!floated floated}` pickers on phone platforms
could be `el`, to align the picker to the field's encapsulating element.

items.name: autoComplete
items.text: Autocomplete is disabled on Picker fields by default.

items.name: edgePicker
items.text:
A configuration object, containing an {@link cfg#xtype} property which specifies
the widget to create if `{@link #cfg!picker}: 'edge'` (or if it's '`auto'` and the
app is on a phone).

Replaces `defaultPhonePicker`

items.name: floatedPicker
items.text:
A configuration object, containing an {@link cfg#xtype} property which specifies
the widget to create if `{@link #cfg!picker}: 'floated'` (or if it's '`auto'` and
the app is *not* on a phone).

Replaces `defaultTabletPicker`

items.name: floatedPickerAlign
items.text:
*Only valud when the {@link #cfg!floatedPicker} is used.
The {@link Ext.Component#method!showBy} alignment string to use when showing the
floated picker by the input field.

items.name: hideTrigger
items.text: `true` to hide the expand {@link #triggers trigger}.

items.name: matchFieldWidth
items.text:
*Only valid when the `{@link #cfg!picker}: 'floated'` is used.
Whether the {@link #cfg!floatedPicker}'s width should be explicitly set to match
the width of the input element.

items.name: picker
items.text:
A string representing the type of picker to use.  Can be one of the following values.

- `'edge'` to use the {@link #edgePicker}, generally used on small formfactor devices.
- `'floated'` to use the {@link #floatedPicker}, generally used on tablets or desktops.
- `'auto'` to allow the framework to select the appropriate picker for the device.

Can also be a config object for the picker.

items.name: pickerSlotAlign
items.text: The alignment of text in the picker created by this Select

items.name: collapse
items.text: Fires when the field's picker is collapsed.

items.name: field
items.text: This field instance

items.name: expand
items.text: Fires when the field's picker is expanded.

items.name: field
items.text: This field instance

items.name: collapseIf
items.text: Runs on touchstart of doc to check to see if we should collapse the picker.

items.name: fromKeyboard
items.text:
Passed as `true` if the keyboard was used
to open the picker. This usually means that picker location should be set.

A function which may be implemented in subclasses which moves the focus
to the value in the {@link #cfg!picker} which matches this field's value.

For example, if you were writing a time picker, this method would be where
you synced the picker's value with the field's value.

components.name: Ext.field.Radio
components.text:
The radio field is an enhanced version of the native browser radio controls and is a good
way of allowing your user to choose one option out of a selection of several (for example,
choosing a favorite color):
```javascript
@example({ framework: 'extjs' })
var form = Ext.create('Ext.form.Panel', {
    fullscreen: true,
    items: [
        {
            xtype: 'radiofield',
            name : 'color',
            value: 'red',
            label: 'Red',
            checked: true
        },
        {
            xtype: 'radiofield',
            name : 'color',
            value: 'green',
            label: 'Green'
        },
        {
            xtype: 'radiofield',
            name : 'color',
            value: 'blue',
            label: 'Blue'
        }
    ]
});
```
```javascript
@example({framework: 'ext-react', packages:['ext-react']})
import React, { Component } from 'react';
import { ExtContainer, ExtFormPanel, ExtRadioField, ExtFieldSet } from '@sencha/ext-react';
const radioProps = {
    name: 'radios'
};

export default class MyExample extends Component {
    render() {
        return (
            <ExtContainer layout="center">
                <ExtFormPanel shadow layout={{type: 'vbox', align: 'left'}}>
                    <ExtRadioField {...radioProps} boxLabel="Checked" value="checked"
                          checked/>
                    <ExtRadioField {...radioProps} boxLabel="Unchecked"
                         value="unchecked"/>
                    <ExtRadioField {...radioProps} boxLabel="Disabled"
                         value="disabled" disabled/>
                </ExtFormPanel>
            </ExtContainer>
        )
    }
}
```

Above we created a simple form which allows the user to pick a color from the options red,
green and blue. Because we gave each of the fields above the same {@link #name}, the radio
field ensures that only one of them can be checked at a time. When we come to get the values
out of the form again or submit it to the server, only 1 value will be sent for each group of
radio fields with the same name:

    form.getValues(); //looks like {color: 'red'}
    form.submit(); //sends a single field back to the server (in this case color: red)

components.name: Ext.field.RadioGroup
components.text:
This Field is useful for containing multiple {@link Ext.field.Radio radiofield}.

It plots items into wither horizontal / vertical depending on
{@link Ext.field.FieldGroupContainer#vertical} config properties.

## Example usage

```javascript
 @example({ framework: 'extjs' })
    Ext.create('Ext.form.Panel', {
        title: 'RadioGroup Example',
        width: 300,
        height: 125,
        fullscreen: true,
        items:[{
            xtype: 'radiogroup',
            label: 'Two Columns',
            // Arrange radio field distributed vertically.
            // Automatically latter items flow to next column if
            // available height is less to display all the items in single column.
            vertical: true,
            height: 100,
            items: [
                { label: 'Item 1', name: 'rb', value: '1' },
                { label: 'Item 2', name: 'rb', value: '2', checked: true},
                { label: 'Item 3', name: 'rb', value: '3' },
                { label: 'Item 4', name: 'rb', value: '4' },
                { label: 'Item 5', name: 'rb', value: '5' },
                { label: 'Item 6', name: 'rb', value: '6' }
            ]
        }]
    });
```
